com.nwollmann.jgame

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nwollmann.jgame.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameLabel

    public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base class for all objects registered with the Game Manager. Any objects with special update or onCollision functionality should be implemented as child classes.
    Author:
    Nicholas Wollmann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameObject()
      Creates a game object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject()
        Creates a game object. By default it is not visible, has no renderer, and is not collidable.

    • Method Detail

      • setPosition

        public final void setPosition(int x,
                              int y)
        Sets the location of this game object. If the game object is collidable then it will also perform collision check.
        Parameters:
        x - Horizontal location in pixels
        y - Vertical location in pixels

      • setPositionX

        public final void setPositionX(int x)
        Sets the horizontal location of the game object. If the game object is collidable then it will also perform a collision check.
        Parameters:
        x - Horizontal location in pixels

      • setPositionY

        public final void setPositionY(int y)
        Sets the vertical location of this game object. If the game object is collidable then it will also perform a collision check.
        Parameters:

      • getPosition

        public final java.awt.Point getPosition()
        Returns the current position of the game object.
        Returns:
        A point containing the current location

      • translate

        public final void translate(int x,
                            int y)
        Shifts the game object by the given values. If the game object is collidable then will also perform a collision check.
        Parameters:
        x - Pixels to add to horizontal location
        y - Pixels to add to vertical location

      • translateX

        public final void translateX(int x)
        Shifts the game object horizontally by the given value. If the game object is collidable then will also perform a collision check.
        Parameters:
        x - Pixels to add to horizontal location

      • translateY

        public final void translateY(int y)
        Shifts the game object vertically by the given value. If the game object is collidable then will also perform a collision check.
        Parameters:
        y - Pixels to add to vertical location

        Parameters:

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether or not this game object is drawn on screen.
        Parameters:
        visible - True if you wish the game object to be rendered

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Returns whether or not this game object is to be drawn on screen.
        Returns:
        True if it will be drawn

      • setLayer

        public void setLayer(int layer)
        Sets the layer in which the game object should be drawn. A higher number will result in the object being drawn closer to the foreground.
        Parameters:
        layer - Layer in which to draw this game object

      • getLayer

        public int getLayer()
        Returns the layer in which this game object should be drawn. A higher number will result in the object being drawn closer to the foreground.
        Returns:
        Layer in which to draw this game object

      • flagForDeletion

        public void flagForDeletion()
        This will mark the object for deletion as soon as the game manager finishes the current update cycle. Once flagged this object will be removed from the game manager, meaning it will no longer be updated, rendered on screen, or checked for collision. It will not, however, nullify this object if you still have references to it within your code.

      • isFlaggedForDeletion

        public boolean isFlaggedForDeletion()
        Returns whether the object is currently flagged for deletion. This will return false until a call is made to the flagForDeletion method after which it will return true.
        Returns:
        True if the object is flagged for deletion

        Parameters:
